title: K so can we give Nidalee the Kassadin treatment now
body:
Let's make her free flash stack up in mana costs

I'm fine with Riot thinking they need to put Kassadin on the shelf for now and come back to him with another approach - let's be honest, that's what they did here. They literally put him in Poppy tier. So why can't we do the same to Nidalee? Nobody likes playing dodge a spear from fog of war. Nobody likes being burdened with trying to engage on a Nidalee comp because lol pounce and resets yay. Honestly, Nidalee has been just as big an issue in competitive play as Kassadin has yet you guys always seem to want to shove her down our throats. Nobody wants to play against this stupid champion. 

Please gut her to the point her spears only do 2 damage until you can figure out how to make her design less toxic to play against.

How so? I explained my reasoning. Nidalee is just as much a problem in competitive play as Kassadin has been. She's a flex pick just like he is. Theres only been short durations in competitive play since season 2 where she hasn't been pick or ban, much like Kassadin. Her gameplay is toxic as shit, do I need to explain this? Everything I've stated is backed by facts, the only difference is Kassadin got gutted and Nidalee hasn't.

Are they broken for the same reason? Somewhat yes but not exactly. Riots excuse is "well you can't hide from Kassadin so this is why we did this." Okay, you can't hide from Leblanc. You can't hide from Zed. You can't hide from Lissandra. You can't hide from any mobile champion who goes in, pops you and either becomes invulnerable or simply uses their mobility spell to go back out. Kassadin, unlike many of these champions, exposes himself in melee range with two of his abilities that are absolutely essential to use otherwise his damage isn't that high. 

What's the other issue? I'm sure part of it is Kassadin is harder to pin down than others but Nidalee is the exact same. So if we really focus this on their competitive strength, their versatility and their overall power, from those stand points alone, Kassadin and Nidalee can be compared. The other reasons why Kassadin is seen as an issue are abused just as much by any other [insert overly mobile champ here]. It's clear Riot hates Kassadin, I guess I can understand why. But for the life of me, why they're only butchering him and not everything that's abusing the same thing he is abusing is beyond me.

I've said it before and I'll say it again: I would much rather face Kassadin than go back to dodge a spear Nidalee. I'd much rather face Kassadin, who has fairly weaker wave clear than go back to league of AFK wave clearers. At least you can seige on a Kassadin. I'd much rather deal with Kassadin than go back to league of utility Mage that CCs your team and 100-0s it at the same time. Contrary to what riot thinks, Kassadin has weaknesses and plays much the same way many other assassins do (stays on the back line then looks to clean up). Maybe he's just too good at it? I don't know, I can deal with that. What I'm not looking forward to dealing with is trying to seige on AFK wave clearers. And if Kassadins clean up is too good, just say it and I'd actually be okay with that because quite frankly it might be too good. But don't say you can't run from him, you can't run from half the champions on this roster so that's a terrible reason. 

Rip Kassadin The LimpWalker

I never said I agreed with the Kassadin nerfs, in fact, I do not. That's just how riot does balance though. 
-Kassadin too strong? Well nerf his Q & E damage and remove silence, we don't want to touch his identidity too much so leave the ult alone. 
-Still too strong? Well stacks decay much slower now, that way he still has his trademark rift, just not that often. 
-We still don't like him? Well nerf his ult to shit then. Wait, what's that? Should we rebuff his other ability now that we decided to massively nerf Riftwalk? Nah -Riot 2015.

Honestly the power of her kit early is getting  6 abilities before people even have 3, base steroids for landing a trap or a spear, free jungle mob roots and built in sustain/mobility. Her clear, poke, counter jungling and 'poke ganks'are all really strong.

Fiddles mana costs are more than understandable gating for the amount of damage he can output.
Another thing to consider is that Nid needs AD for her execute to be of use, but requires AP for the rest of her kit to be useful. (The base healing on her heal is meh at best.)
She has a good kit, but calling her a monster with free sustain and poke is incorrect.  Nid HAS to get ahead, the jungle is likely the last place where you're going to get ahead, even with Nid.

Lich bane. Execution problems solved. Mana problems solved. Fiddle is only good at cc and dealing damage if the enemy stays in one area. Nid deals damage to anyone within her large area of control and is nearly never out of position due to the nature of her kit. Even if you DO catch her by surprise,  the amount of get out of jail free cards she has, coupled with her damage is overwhelming for many who don't even have a single dash.

Thought I would answer with a few points that just jumped to mind when I read this, and I'm sure you'll have other people replying as well.

Firstly, being in the fog of war as a jungler isn't too difficult. Especially when you consider the range on her spears. Warding helps, but you need to ward the same distance as a post-6 Rengar, only this time it's at level 2, and a pink ain't gonna save you. Nidalee has less CC though to lock you down, so there's that at least.

Secondly, if you can't land a Nidalee spear from the fog of war, then it usually means that your ganking choices were sub-par (such as doing so when the opponent's next minion waves were coming in, or diving near their turret at early ranks). If they are in their minions, then don't gank from near your side of the lane.

Third points carries a descent point, although a lot of the other really powerful junglers do have the same requirements.

Nidalee jungle, however, has very little in the way of a "skill cap". Most of the time, it's wait for a spear to land (or a team-mate's hard CC), then go cougar and mash keyboard. You can still deal pretty good damage without landing a spear, since you can still cougar and pounce in anyways. You have the long range poke and the bruiser potential, so you should use it.

Yes he had a 700 range dash on a roughly 3 second cooldown but, and this is hard for a lot of people to believe, plenty of champions could escape. Lack of vision? You Rift Walk the wrong way out of two and they get away. You can't chase endlessly because of the mana cost and if you don't have vision it's just asking for death. It doesn't make it an instant win button as so many believe either. There are plenty of other champions that can chase you down but he was the best at it in some situations.

Something else I seem to be saying a lot. Just because he could chase someone down and do some decent damage late game or when fed hard doesn't mean he's overpowered. ADCs can kill you in 3 basic attacks if you're not a tank and even tanks die pretty fast. All Kassadin had was his ability to wear you down or finish off a kill and now he doesn't even have that.

While I agree that Nidalee is very strong right now, I don't think she needs to be gutted by any means.  

*  It's true that Pounce has no mana cost.  However, as an escape, Pounce has a lower range than Riftwalk.  While 75 range doesn't seem like much, it greatly limits wall-jumping.  Admittedly, as an engage tool, Pounce has a longer range, but it already had that before the Kassadin nerf.  Additionally, Pounce does less damage than Riftwalk.
*  Nidalee's spears can be dodged.  **This does not make them weak.  I am not making that claim.**  However, this means that it is possible to avoid some of Nidalee's damage, especially considering that the width was nerfed a while back.  Meanwhile, Kassadin's Null Sphere is targeted and gives him a magic damage shield.
*  Nidalee's passive gives her movement speed until she triggers a hunt, at which point ONE of her abilities gets bonus damage against ONE target.  Compare this to a free 15% magic damage reduction and no unit collision.
*  Nidalee has no CC except her root, which is against monsters only.
*  Nidalee is squishy (with her current build path), while Kassadin builds a RoA early (and the previously mentioned free magic damage reduction).
*  Nidalee has received exactly 2 changes in the past few patches.  One allowed her to hunt monsters.  The other was a bugfix (technically a nerf) which prevented her from resetting cooldowns except in the 2 cases where it's supposed to happen (Hunting a target, and pouncing said hunted target)
